messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full path:
- /v1/users/{user}/comments

All HTTP methods acceptable:
- all: false

Methods allowed (based on the code):
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- In routes/api.php there is a Route group with prefix('v1'), and inside it the nested resource route Route::apiResource('users.comments', UserCommentController::class)->only('index'); is declared. The only('index') restriction means the only route registered from that resource is the index action.
- The index action for a nested resource corresponds to the HTTP GET method and the path /users/{user}/comments. With the group prefix('v1') applied, the full path becomes /v1/users/{user}/comments.
- The controller App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserCommentController defines the index(Request $request, User $user) method, which returns the user's comments â€” matching the GET index route.
- No other HTTP methods (POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, etc.) are registered by the route declaration for this controller (only index was requested), and no explicit HEAD/OPTIONS/TRACE routes are declared in the provided application code. Following your instruction to base acceptability on the code (not on implicit framework behavior), only GET is marked as acceptable.
